long_desc.thetext:
qooxdoo should react on size changes of the font made by the user (e.g. through the browser font size setting)
Not sure however how relevant this is as most browsers nowadays support real page zooming as well (with images etc.)
Long grown priorities normalized to P5 to increase a few of them afterwards.

I think the biggest 'bug' in qooxdoo (when using the Browser-Zoom-Funktion, e.g. the Keypresses Ctrl-+ and Ctrl-- and Ctrl-0 or Ctrl-Mousewheel) is, that the automatically calculated widths of Widget according to the containig text-String is not perfect.
So it happens quite often, that there is not enough 'width' to display the whole label. In that case, the text is cutted of an a hyphen (three dots ...) is appended.
You can see this in the Demo-Browser (http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/demobrowser/). Just open it an then use Ctrl-Mousewheel to Increase or Decrease Font-Size (resp. Zoom in/out). In both 'directions' there are always some Labels/Buttons/TreeElemennts/MenuItems which are not displayed complete.
Oliver Henning
